H0.text: Creating shelter is an example of an octopus squirting black ink around itself to hide from predators.

H1.text: Recycling nutrients is an example of an adaptation where an octopus squirts black ink around itself to hide from predators.

H2.text: A transfer of energy is an example of an octopus squirting black ink around itself to hide from predators.

H3.text: A defense mechanism is an adaptation in which an octopus squirts black ink around itself to hide from predators.

A4.text: Octopus try to escape from a predator by ejecting an ink cloud, which acts as a 'smoke-screen' or a decoy, as well as to interfere with the attacker's sense of smell.

A5.text: The veined octopus collects discarded coconut shells, then uses them to build a shelter, an example of tool use.
